column4: So I've been having trouble with my mouse pointer elastically returning to the middle of the screen
I've been googling it for ages and haven't found a fix, but I've just read that an application that does not like
forced mouse warping includes the mouse pointer elastically returning to the middle of the screen
Is this true, and if so, is there any way to fix it so my mouse will hide when running some applications?
unclutter will hide your mouse pointer but I don't understand what you said before that
When running some applications (specifically Far Cry 2) my desktop cursor stays in the middle of the screen
When I move the mouse the cursor moves for a little bit before returning to the center of the screen
The in game cursor works fine
Yeah. I've been asking about it in #wine and so far have no responses
does it happen outside of wine?  Like watching a full screen movie for example?
or even one of the native fps on linux
Watching a fullscreen movie is fine. It only happens when running some games
It only seems to happen in windowed mode. When I run it in fullscreen it's fine, but the game doesn't take up the whole screen
And when I quit, there seems to be some invisible barriers preventing me from moving my mouse to the far right and bottom of my screen
